item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 3, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The Tube Computer (64 points | 23 comments)
2. Intel announces Arc B-series "Battlemage" discrete graphics with Linux support (147 points | 278 comments)
3. Skia Canvas: Browserless implementation of the HTML Canvas drawing API for node (104 points | 50 comments)
4. Show HN: I built an AI tool to analyze SEC filings the minute they're released (17 points | 11 comments)
5. My brand new digitizing workflow using a 25 year old film scanner (39 points | 16 comments)
6. Openlayer (YC S21) is looking for top-tier design engineers ( | hide)
7. Text Editing Hates You Too (2019) (48 points | 14 comments)
8. Amazon Nova (159 points | 52 comments)
9. Egoless Engineering (5 points | discuss)
10. Tweaking Stunt Island's 30-year-old 3D engine (149 points | 33 comments)
11. Phishers Love New TLDs Like .shop, .top and .xyz (69 points | 111 comments)
12. EstyJS 2.0 (emulator for the Atari ST, written in 100% pure JavaScript) (11 points | 2 comments)
13. Launch HN: Vocera (YC F24) – Testing and Observability for Voice AI (33 points | 17 comments)
14. ‘With brain preservation, nobody has to die’ (51 points | 180 comments)
15. Lessons I learned working at an art gallery (396 points | 155 comments)
16. On-scalp printing of personalized electroencephalography e-tattoos (28 points | 1 comment)
17. The Curse of Markdown (63 points | 62 comments)
18. MyTimeMachine: Personalized Facial Age Transformation (16 points | 2 comments)
19. Student rocket group shatters amateur space record (213 points | 192 comments)
20. South Korean president declares martial law, parliament votes to lift it (500 points | 535 comments)
21. Ask HN: Payment processing for micro SaaS outside USA? (44 points | 39 comments)
22. Amazon Aurora DSQL (96 points | 70 comments)
23. FTC Bans Location Data Company That Powers the Surveillance Ecosystem (58 points | 16 comments)
24. 'I'm running a Mud so I can learn C programming ' (1993) (85 points | 69 comments)
25. AI poetry is indistinguishable from human poetry and is rated more favorably (46 points | 89 comments)
26. Rust in QEMU Roadmap (204 points | 109 comments)
27. We switched from Next.js to Astro (and why it might interest you) (110 points | 87 comments)
28. Vintage digicams aren't just a fad. They're an artistic statement (82 points | 161 comments)
29. Ask HN: Who is hiring? (December 2024) (352 points | 341 comments)
30. MTA's A.I. bus cameras issue mistaken parking violations (44 points | 40 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 3, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
